titles: A parte of a register contayninge sundrie memorable matters, written by diuers godly and learned in our time, which stande for, and desire the reformation of our Church, in discipline and ceremonies, accordinge to the pure worde of God, and the lawe of our lande.
author: Udall, John, 1560?-1592. Demonstration of the trueth of that discipline which Christe hath prescribed in his worde for the government of his Church, in all times and places, untill the ende of the worlde.
notes: Publication place and printer's name supplied and publication date conjectured by STC.

"A demonstration of the trueth of that discipline which Christ hath prescribed in his worde for the gouernment of his Church, in all times and places, vntill the end of the world" (caption title) by John Udall, originally published in 1588, has separate pagination and register.
Quire E of part 1 is in two settings; E1r line 1 begins (1) "saieth" or (2) "sayeth".
"A demonstration of the trueth" identified as STC 24500 on UMI microfilm reel 364.
Reproductions of the originals in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
keywords: Church of England --  Controversial literature --  Early works to 1800.
